intro: Pelargonium alneum, commonly known as the alneum geranium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Geraniaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of pink, red, and white, typically blooming in spring and summer. Its foliage is characterized by heart-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Pelargonium alneum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in garden settings.
